DND4E.ApplyEffectTooltip: Applies the power's (All/Ally/Enemy) Effects to the targeted/selected tokens (change between targeted/selected in game options)

DND4E.ApplyMissEffectTooltip: Applies the power's on-Miss Effects to the targeted/selected tokens (change between targeted/selected in game options)
DND4E.ApplyHitOrMissEffectTooltip: Applies the power's on-Hit-or-Miss Effects to the targeted/selected tokens (change between targeted/selected in game options)

DND4E.BonusesInstructions: Configure character bonuses which are added to the appropriate dice roll

DND4E.CurrencyConvertHint: Convert all carried currency to the highest possible denomination to reduce the amount of coinage carried by the character. Be wary, this action cannot be undone.

DND4E.DeathSaveFailure: has died with 3 death save failures!
DND4E.DeathSaveSuccess: has survived with 3 death save successes and is now stable!

ignoredDispositions.hint: Tokens with these dispositions will not be affected by this difficult terrain.
ignoredDispositions.label: Ignored Dispositions

types.hint: Types that best describe the source of this difficult terrain, if any.
types.label: Types

Type.Forest: Trees, Underbrush, Plants, or Natural Growth

EFFECT.DurationSecsTip:
Reference only; this setting is not used by the system for automatic expiry.
However, it may be used by other modules.
EFFECTDESC.mark:
• The creature takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls if the marking creature is not a target.
  • Only one mark can be applied to a creature at any given time, with a new mark replacing an existing one.
  • A mark expires instantly if its creator dies or falls unconscious.
EFFECTDESC.bloodied: The creature's current hit points are lower than half of its total hit points.
EFFECTDESC.attackUp: The creature has a temporary bonus to attack or damage rolls.
EFFECTDESC.attackDown: The creature has a temporary penalty to attack or damage rolls.
EFFECTDESC.defUp: The creature has a temporary bonus to one or more defenses.
EFFECTDESC.defDown: The creature has a temporary penalty to one or more defenses.
EFFECTDESC.regen: At the start of the creature's turn, if it has at least 1 hit point, it regains the specified number of hit points.
EFFECTDESC.ammoCount: The creature is using special ammunition or equipment.
EFFECTDESC.curse: The creature is subject to a Warlock's Curse.
EFFECTDESC.oath: The creature is subject to an Oath of Enmity.
EFFECTDESC.huntermark: The creature is subject to a Hunter's Mark.
EFFECTDESC.target: A special effect is targeting this creature.
EFFECTDESC.ongoing: The creature is suffering ongoing damage that will be dealt at the start of its turn.
EFFECTDESC.blinded:
• The creature can't see; any target is considered to have total concealment from it.
  • The creature takes a -10 penalty to perception checks.
  • The creature can't flank.
  • The creature grants combat advantage.
EFFECTDESC.comAdv: The creature gains a +2 bonus to attack rolls against a target granting combat advantage to it.
EFFECTDESC.concealed: The creature is difficult to see. Melee and ranged attack rolls against it take a -2 penalty.
EFFECTDESC.concealedfull: The creature cannot be seen. Melee and ranged attack rolls against it suffer a -5 penalty.
EFFECTDESC.cover: The creature is taking cover. Attacks from a square without four unobstructed corner lines to the creature's square suffer a -2 penalty to hit it. (If three or more corner lines are obstructed, upgrade to Superior Cover.)
EFFECTDESC.coversup: The creature is taking cover in a well-protected square. Attacks from a square without three or more unobstructed corner lines to the creature's square suffer a -5 penalty to hit it. (If two or fewer corner lines are obstructed, downgrade to Cover.)
EFFECTDESC.dazed:
• On its turn, the creature may take either a standard, a move, or a minor action.
  • The creature cannot take opportunity or immediate actions.
  • The creature can't flank.
  • The creature grants combat advantage.
EFFECTDESC.dead: â˜  The creature is dead! â˜
EFFECTDESC.deafened:
• The creature cannot hear.
  • The creature takes a -10 penalty to perception checks that involve listening.
EFFECTDESC.disarmed: The creature may not be able to use some weapon-based powers.
EFFECTDESC.dominated:
• The creature can't take actions voluntarily. Instead, the dominator chooses a single action for the creature to take on the creature's turn: a standard, a move, a minor, or a free action. The dominator can only make the creature use At-Will powers or features.
  • If the dominator tries to force the creature to enter dangerous terrain (such as leaping from a height or a space that would cause other harm) the creature gets a saving throw to resist entering the terrain.
  • The creature cannot take opportunity or immediate actions.
  • The creature can't flank.
  • The creature grants combat advantage.
  • The creature's disposition does not change; its allies remain its allies, and its enemies remain its enemies.
EFFECTDESC.dying: The creature is unconscious, and must make a death saving throw at the start of each of its turns. This condition ends immediately if the creature regains hit points.
EFFECTDESC.grabbed:
• The creature is immobilized.
  • The creature can attempt to escape as a move action.
  • The grab ends immediately if the grabber is subjected to an effect that prevents it from taking actions, or if the creature ends up outside the range of the grabbing power or effect.
EFFECTDESC.grantingCA: The creature is granting combat advantage to attackers.
EFFECTDESC.immobilized: The creature cannot move except by teleportation. It can still be pushed, pulled, or slid.
EFFECTDESC.insubstantial: The creature takes half damage from any damage source, including ongoing damage.
EFFECTDESC.invisible:
• The creature has total concealment.
  • The creature doesn't provoke opportunity attacks from enemies that can't perceive it.
  • Enemies that can't perceive the creature grant combat advantage to it.
EFFECTDESC.mounted: The creature is mounted upon another creature.
EFFECTDESC.petrified:
• The creature is unconscious.
  • The creature has resist 20 to all damage.
  • The creature doesn't age.
EFFECTDESC.prone:
• The creature is lying down.
  • If the creature is climbing or flying, it falls.
  • The creature cannot move except by crawling or teleporting. It can still be pulled, pushed, or slid.
  • The creature takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls.
  • The creature grants combat advantage to attackers making melee attacks against it, but it gains a +2 bonus to all defenses against ranged attacks from attackers that aren't adjacent to it.
EFFECTDESC.removed: The creature can't take actions. It has neither line of sight nor line of effect to anything, and nothing has line of sight or line of effect to it.
EFFECTDESC.restrained:
• The creature can't move, unless it teleports. It can't even be pulled, pushed, or slid.
  • The creature takes a -2 penalty to attack rolls.
    • The creature grants combat advantage.
EFFECTDESC.running:
The creature has taken the run action.

  • The creature takes a -5 penalty to attack rolls until the start of its next turn.
  • The creature grants combat advantage until the start of its next turn.
EFFECTDESC.slowed:
• The creature's speed is reduced to 2. This speed applies to all of the creature's movement modes (walking, flying, swimming, and so on), but it does not apply to forced movement against it, teleportation, or any other movement that doesn't use the creature's speed.
  • If the creature is subjected to this condition while it is moving, it must stop if it has already moved at least 2 squares.
  • The creature cannot benefit from bonuses to speed, although it can use powers and take actions, such as the run action, that allow it to move farther than its speed.
EFFECTDESC.squeezing:
The creature has taken the squeeze action.

  • If the creature is Large or larger, its size category effectively decreases by one. When it starts squeezing, it is considered to be leaving spaces it no longer occupies.
  • The creature grants combat advantage.
  • The creature takes a -5 penalty to attack rolls.
EFFECTDESC.stunned:
• The creature can't take actions.
  • The creature grants combat advantage.
  • The creature can't flank.
  • The creature falls if it is flying, unless it can hover.
EFFECTDESC.surprised:
• The creature can't take actions.
  • The creature grants combat advantage.
  • The creature can't flank.
EFFECTDESC.unconscious:
• The creature is helpless.
  • The creature can't take actions.
  • The creature takes a -5 penalty to all defenses.
  • The creature is unaware of its surroundings.
  • The creature falls prone, if possible.
  • The creature can't flank.
EFFECTDESC.weakened: The creature's attacks deal half damage. This does not affect ongoing damage or damage that isnâ€™t generated by an attack roll.
EFFECTDESC.hidden: The creature is hidden or disguised.
EFFECTDESC.sneaking: The creature is being stealthy. It is hidden (invisible and silent) from creatures that fail to detect it.
EFFECTDESC.torch: The creature is holding a light source.
ERROR.4eCopyStatusDetails: Could not copy status details. This is expected if you have changed the standard list of status conditions since adding one to this effect.
DND4EUI.AutoFromConfigTip: These keywords have been inferred from the power's settings. If something looks wrong, the config may need updating!
DND4EUI.ConditionalBonusesTip: Configure common conditional modifiers for this character
DND4EUI.CountsAsAttackTip: This attack always has the checked qualities. For attacks that are only sometimes rolled as charge or opportunity attacks, see 'Display' at the bottom of the sheet.
DND4EUI.ImportJSONInput: Input JSON to import in the field below
DND4EUI.Label: Label
DND4EUI.RollVariantsTip: Adds extra context menu options to roll this attack in a special way.
DND4EUI.UnknownCondition.Label: Unknown value
DND4EUI.UnknownCondition.Tip: No match was found for this id in the current status conditions configuration.
SETTINGS.4eApplyEffectsToSelectionN: Buttons to apply effects should apply to SELECTED tokens
SETTINGS.4eApplyEffectsToSelectionL: If checked, apply effect buttons will work over targets that are SELECTED.  Otherwise will work over tokens that are TARGETED
SETTINGS.4eAutoApplyEffectsL: When checked, power effects/conditions are applied automatically to valid selected targets when an attack roll is made (for non-attacks, when a power is used).
SETTINGS.4eAutoCollapseCardL: Automatically collapse Item Card descriptions in the Chat Log
SETTINGS.4eAutoDoTsL: How to handle ongoing damage/regeneration (from effects) at the start of a creature's turn
SETTINGS.4eAutoDoTsPublicL: For what type of actors should ongoing damage be publicly visible?
SETTINGS.4eAutomationCombatL: Determine whether the Attack Roll hits or misses.
SETTINGS.4eAutoSpellTemplateL: When a spell is cast, defaults to begin the process to create the corresponding Measured Template if any (requires TRUSTED or higher player role)
SETTINGS.4eCardAtkDisplayL: When an attack has an associated ability score, how should the auto power card show the name and attack bonus value?
SETTINGS.4eCardAtkDisplayBoth: Display name and bonus (formula in tooltip)
SETTINGS.4eCollapseSituationalBonusL: If checked: all common situational modifiers will be computed and added as a single modifier to @bonus.  Otherwise each will be displayed individually in the resulting formula
SETTINGS.4eCurWtL: Carried currency affects character encumbrance following the rules on PHB pg. 212.
SETTINGS.4eDamageCalcL: Configure which version of the rules damage resistance, vulnerability and immunities will be used. Errata favors offense using the lowest resistance, while the PHB rules even split the damage types and use individual resistances.
SETTINGS.4eDarkModeL: Favor dark BG/light text in UI elements (likely to conflict with other UI mods)
SETTINGS.4eDeathSaveRestL: Choose a reset condition for failed death saves. Useful if you want to run a more deadly campaign than the default of "short rest" provides.
SETTINGS.4eDebugPowerEffectsL: Will output a lot of debug information to the console when attempting to apply effects to power attack and damage rolls.  Useful to see why a given effect is applying at a given value
SETTINGS.4eDiagL: Configure which diagonal movement rule should be used for games within this system.
SETTINGS.4eFastFowardSettingsL: All rolls and actions buttons will now default to using the fast-forward option that skips dialog boxes. To have the roll dialog box while in this mode, use the key binds normally associated with fast-forward
SETTINGS.4eHalfLevelOptionsL: Turns off half levels for Ability, Defense, Skills and Initiative score values.
SETTINGS.4eInhEnhL: Apply a level-based floor to the enhancement bonus of player characters' attacks, damage and defenses (as per the optional rules for games where magic gear is rare).
SETTINGS.4eInitTBL: How should ties in initiative be resolved?
SETTINGS.4eItemDeleteConfirmationL: When trying to delete any power or inventory item from a sheet, a confirmation dialog will display first.
SETTINGS.4eMarkAutomationL: The system will control the shared/universal properties of Mark effects, such as attack penalties and new marks taking priority.
SETTINGS.4eNoExpL: Remove experience bars from character sheets.
SETTINGS.4eNpcMathOptionsL: Determines if the Advanced Math Options for NPCs is set during their generation
SETTINGS.4epermShowPlayerL: When clicking the show player button on an item while holding this key, it will permanently give all players permission to see the item rather then them only being shown the item temporarily.
SETTINGS.4ePowerAutoGenerateLableOptionL: When creating a new power, determine if the option to "Auto Generate Power Card Details" is set.
SETTINGS.4eSaveRemindersL: Each "save ends" effect on a creature prompts for a saving throw at the end of their turn, or rolls a save automatically if Fast-Forward is enabled.
SETTINGS.4eShowRollExpressionL: Display the formula used to create a given d20 or damage roll.  Useful to find out how a roll was calculate but may be confusing for novice users
SETTINGS.4eShowCustomSkillH: Options for adding in custom skills for characters into the game system
SETTINGS.4eShowDefencesL: Display defense values in attack roll chat cards for PCs, NPCs, or everyone
MACRO.4eMissingTargetWarn: Your controlled actor '{actor}' does not have an {type} with name '{name}'.
MACRO.4eMultipleTargetsWarn: Your controlled actor '{actor}' has more than one {type} with name '{name}'. The first match will be chosen.
MIGRATION.4eBegin: Applying DnD4E System Migration for version {version}. Please be patient and do not close your game or shut down your server.
MIGRATION.4eComplete: DnD4E System Migration to version {version} completed!
MIGRATION.4eVersionTooOldWarning: Your DnD4e system data is from too old a Foundry version and cannot be reliably migrated to the latest version. The process will be attempted, but errors may occur.
